content.description: Sit start on the arrowhead shaped hold and move slightly left to the severely overhanging arête. Climb up the arête until you can reach the arching right facing flake. Continue left on the flake and topout.
content.location: Start on the left side under the steep overhang on the Grunge Boulder on an obvious large triangular jug hold.

content.description: Stand on the pedestal with a right undercling pinch and a left hand crimp rail. Climb straight up to topout. Tall with not the best landing.
content.location: This line goes straight up from the large flat rock in the ground.

content.description: Start underneath an arrowhead shaped hold. Move through the arrowhead and trend left to crimps. Use small holds to pull around the lip and onto the face. Continue up the stand start variation and topout the same.
content.protection: Multiple pads or a good spotter.
content.location: Start on the left side under the steep overhang on the Grunge Boulder below an obvious large triangular jug hold.

content.description:
Sit start matched in the hole and move out and right through a big move to some crimps. Continue out right (out of the overhang) to a large sidepull crimp on the slab that will take you to the top. Gain the slab and jump down, or topout for no extra points, but a little extra danger.

Backwall is off for feet.
content.location: This line starts on the right side of the steep overhang on the Grunge Boulder.

content.description: Start on a big jug then use edges and slopers to move up to jugs. Topout the same as The Box.
content.location: On the face of the Grunge Boulder in front of the tree.

content.description: Stand start on slopers behind the tree. Climb up and right to a jug. Continue up through large ledges to topout.
content.location: This line is the left-most line on the face of the Grunge Boulder. Topout may be a little dirty.

content.description: Start in the heuco, similarly to Down in a Hole. Traverse left on a sloper edge to the start of Outshined and continue up that line to topout.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a nice spotter.
content.location: This line starts on the right side of the steep overhang on the Grunge Boulder.

content.description: Originally a V7 (Aneurism) until a jug hold broke. Sit start on the arrowhead shaped hold and move right through the roof. Sloping holds and hard moves with small crimps await anyone who is strong enough to repeat this line after a major breakage. There are jugs at the lip and the topout is easy in comparison.
content.location: Start on the left side under the steep overhang on the Grunge Boulder on an obvious large triangular jug hold.
